scenario_text.value: ...you. Thank you...

Miu? Is that you? Were you saying something
just now?
Wha-?! T-Takuma?!
Uh, nope! Not a thing!

Miu was just saying thanks to the school
building.
Shakomon!
(What can I say about that?)
What do you mean?
Maybe you shouldn’t.
What do you mean?
What do you mean? Could you tell me more?

Oh, sure... But, uh... Eheheh, it’s a little
embarrassing...
Maybe you shouldn’t.

Miu, we’re going to be leaving this place
soon. Maybe you shouldn’t get so attached...

What? Takuma, don’t you know that’s rude?
It’s important to say thank you.

You think we should just leave here without
a word? How disrespectful can you get?
Uh...yeah, you’re right. Sorry.

Heheh, Miu, you’ve gotten so much more
mature.

You know, everything here has been really
hard, but...

I can’t help feeling something for this
place. I guess you’d call it an affection?

And don’t you think we owe this school
building a lot? It’s basically been our home.

So, I thought it was only right to say
thanks.
Oh, okay.

(She feels indebted to this place, and wanted
to say thank you. Miu sure is nice.)
So, you’ve been thanking the school?
That’s real cute.
That’s great!
That’s real cute.
That’s real cute.

Grrr... Takuma! You’re treating me like
a little kid right now, aren’t you?
Am I? I didn’t mean to...
(Well, maybe just a little.)
I don’t believe you!

No, seriously! I just thought it was a cute
thing to do, that’s all!
I don’t know... Sounds like an excuse to me.
Miu...

Heheh, I’m just kidding. I’m not really mad.
You never make fun of me, Takuma.
Haha, I’m glad you believe me...
That’s great!
That’s great! I never even thought of that.
Really? You...think it’s a good idea?

I do. It’s very thoughtful, and just like
you. I think it’s a great idea.
Eheheh, stop, you’re embarrassing me...
Oh, Miu, your whole face is changing color!
So, would you like to join me?
What? You want me to say thanks, too?
(Say thanks? Should I?)
You know what? Sure.
Maybe not...
You know what? Sure.
You know what? Sure.
Right!

Thanks, old school building! Thank you for
keeping us all safe!

Thanks for helping us get along, and for
letting my brother make friends besides me!
Thanks, old school building!

(Miu really is a nice kid. I can understand
why Kaito cares so much for her.)
Come on, Takuma! You say something too!
Thanks, old school building...
I can barely hear you! Say it louder!
Thank you for keeping us safe!!!
(This really is kind of embarrassing.)
Hee hee... Thanks.
Maybe not...
I think I’d better not.

No? Heheh, it is kind of embarrassing, isn’t
it?
Then I’ll just have to thank it for you, too.

I’ll get ready after I finish saying thank
you.
Let’s go, Shakomon!
Right!

They both have so much energy. I’ll need to
really give this my all, too.

Want to join us, Takuma? Come on, all
together now... Thanks, old school building!
